skos:prefLabel "Flap gate" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Flashboards   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Flashboards

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Flashboards is a leaf node.

Description

Structural members of timber, concrete, or steel placed in channels or on the crest of a spillway to raise the reservoir water level but that may be quickly removed in the event of a flood.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Flashboards a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Flashboards" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=504" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Flashboards]" ;
skos:definition "Structural members of timber, concrete, or steel placed in channels or on the crest of a spillway to raise the reservoir water level but that may be quickly removed in the event of a flood." ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;
skos:prefLabel "Flashboards" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Flip_bucket   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Flip_bucket

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Flip_bucket is a leaf node.

Description

An energy dissipater located at the downstream end of a spillway and shaped so that water flowing at a high velocity is deflected upwards in a trajectory away from the foundation of the spillway.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Flip_bucket a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Flip bucket" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=504" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Flip bucket]" ;
skos:definition "An energy dissipater located at the downstream end of a spillway and shaped so that water flowing at a high velocity is deflected upwards in a trajectory away from the foundation of the spillway." ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;
skos:prefLabel "Flip bucket" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Flood   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Flood

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Flood is a leaf node.

Description

A general and temporary condition of partial or complete inundation of two or more acres of normally dry land area or of two or more properties from: (1) overflow of inland or tidal waters; (2) unusual and rapid accumulation or runoff of surface waters from any source; (3) mudflow; or (4) collapse or subsidence of land along the shore of a lake or similar body of water as a result of erosion or undermining caused by waves or currents of water exceeding anticipated cyclical levels that result in a flood as defined above. The four terms below are used to further define flooding and efforts to prevent flooding.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Flood a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Flood" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=504" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Flood]" ;
skos:definition "A general and temporary condition of partial or complete inundation of two or more acres of normally dry land area or of two or more properties from: (1) overflow of inland or tidal waters; (2) unusual and rapid accumulation or runoff of surface waters from any source; (3) mudflow; or (4) collapse or subsidence of land along the shore of a lake or similar body of water as a result of erosion or undermining caused by waves or currents of water exceeding anticipated cyclical levels that result in a flood as defined above. The four terms below are used to further define flooding and efforts to prevent flooding." ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;
skos:prefLabel "Flood" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Flood,_Inflow_Design_%28IDF%29   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Flood,_Inflow_Design_%28IDF%29

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Flood,_Inflow_Design_%28IDF%29 is a leaf node.

Description

The flood used in the design of a dam and its appurtenant works particularly for sizing the spillway and outlet works, and for determining maximum temporary storage and height of dam requirements.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .

@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

rdfs:label "Flood, Inflow Design (IDF)" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=505" ;

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Flood,_Probable_Maximum_%28PMF%29   back to top

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Flood,_Probable_Maximum_%28PMF%29 is a leaf node.

Description

The most severe flood that is considered reasonably possible at a site as a result of meteorological and hydrologic conditions.

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Flood,_base_safety_standard_%28BSS%29   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Flood,_base_safety_standard_%28BSS%29

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Flood,_base_safety_standard_%28BSS%29 is a leaf node.

Description

The inflow design flood where there is no significant increase in adverse consequences from dam failure compared to non-failure adverse consequences.

Implementation:

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Flood_Control   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Flood_Control

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Flood_Control is a leaf node.

Description

The Flood Control Act of 1936 declared that flood control was a national priority since floods constituted a menace to the national welfare. This act authorized the construction of levees, floodwalls, channel improvements, and reservoirs to control flooding.Flood Control

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Flood_Control a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Flood Control" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=504" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Flood Control]" ;
skos:definition "The Flood Control Act of 1936 declared that flood control was a national priority since floods constituted a menace to the national welfare. This act authorized the construction of levees, floodwalls, channel improvements, and reservoirs to control flooding.Flood Control" ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;
skos:prefLabel "Flood Control" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Flood_Damage_Reduction   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Flood_Damage_Reduction

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Flood_Damage_Reduction is a leaf node.

Description

The term flood damage reduction was adopted in recognition that the structures built for flood control only reduced the level of flooding and did not totally control all floods. Projects developed for flood damage reduction also include non-structural elements.Flood Damage Reduction

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Flood_Damage_Reduction a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Flood Damage Reduction" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=504" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Flood Damage Reduction]" ;
skos:definition "The term flood damage reduction was adopted in recognition that the structures built for flood control only reduced the level of flooding and did not totally control all floods. Projects developed for flood damage reduction also include non-structural elements.Flood Damage Reduction" ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;
skos:prefLabel "Flood Damage Reduction" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Flood_Level   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Flood_Level

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Flood_Level is a leaf node.

Description

The size of a flood may be expressed in terms of probability, of exceedance per year such as one percent chance flood or expressed as a fraction of the probable maximum flood or other reference flood.Flood Level

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Flood_Level a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Flood Level" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=504" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Flood Level]" ;
skos:definition "The size of a flood may be expressed in terms of probability, of exceedance per year such as one percent chance flood or expressed as a fraction of the probable maximum flood or other reference flood.Flood Level" ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;
skos:prefLabel "Flood Level" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Flood_Risk_Management   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Flood_Risk_Management

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Flood_Risk_Management is a leaf node.

Description

This term recognizes that there are different levels of risks in flood control works and in flood damage reduction activities. Since all flood management structures and other features have a risk of failure, the current practice is to seek to reduce the risk to a tolerable level that the public is willing to accept.Flood Risk Management

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Flood_Risk_Management a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Flood Risk Management" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=504" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Flood Risk Management]" ;
skos:definition "This term recognizes that there are different levels of risks in flood control works and in flood damage reduction activities. Since all flood management structures and other features have a risk of failure, the current practice is to seek to reduce the risk to a tolerable level that the public is willing to accept.Flood Risk Management" ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;
skos:prefLabel "Flood Risk Management" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Flood_gate   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Flood_gate

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Flood_gate is a leaf node.

Description

A gate to control flood release from a reservoir.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Flood_gate a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Flood gate" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=506" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Flood gate]" ;
skos:definition "A gate to control flood release from a reservoir." ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;
skos:prefLabel "Flood gate" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Flood_routing   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Flood_routing

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Flood_routing is a leaf node.

Description

A process of determining progressively over time the amplitude of a flood wave as it moves past a dam or downstream to successive points along a river or stream.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Flood_routing a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Flood routing" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=505" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Flood routing]" ;
skos:definition "A process of determining progressively over time the amplitude of a flood wave as it moves past a dam or downstream to successive points along a river or stream." ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;
skos:prefLabel "Flood routing" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Future_Without_Federal_Action_Condition   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Future_Without_Federal_Action_Condition

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Future_Without_Federal_Action_Condition is a leaf node.

Description

The condition, data, or other representations of the topic of interest to be used for comparison of changes which may occur without intervention or as a result of a remediation alternative remediation. It is comprised of the existing conditions and such future projected conditions as chosen to be relevant for the comparison.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Geotextiles   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Geotextiles

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Geotextiles is a leaf node.

Description

Any fabric or textile (natural or synthetic) when used as an engineering material in conjunction with soil, foundations, or rock. Geotextiles have the following uses: drainage, filtration, separation of materials, reinforcement, moisture barriers, and erosion protection.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Geotextiles a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Geotextiles" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=507" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Geotextiles]" ;
skos:definition "Any fabric or textile (natural or synthetic) when used as an engineering material in conjunction with soil, foundations, or rock. Geotextiles have the following uses: drainage, filtration, separation of materials, reinforcement, moisture barriers, and erosion protection." ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;
skos:prefLabel "Geotextiles" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Grout   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Grout

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Grout is a leaf node.

Description

A fluidized material that is injected into soil, rock, concrete, or other construction material to seal openings and to lower the permeability and/or provide additional structural strength. There are four major types of grouting materials: chemical, cement, clay, and bitumen.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Grout a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Grout" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=507" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Grout]" ;
skos:definition "A fluidized material that is injected into soil, rock, concrete, or other construction material to seal openings and to lower the permeability and/or provide additional structural strength. There are four major types of grouting materials: chemical, cement, clay, and bitumen." ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;
skos:prefLabel "Grout" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Grout_curtain   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Grout_curtain

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Grout_curtain is a leaf node.

Description

One or more zones, usually thin, in the foundation into which grout is injected to reduce seepage under or around a dam.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Grout_curtain a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Grout curtain" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=507" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Grout curtain]" ;
skos:definition "One or more zones, usually thin, in the foundation into which grout is injected to reduce seepage under or around a dam." ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;
skos:prefLabel "Grout curtain" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:HAZUS   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:HAZUS

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:HAZUS is a leaf node.

Description

A database and software system sponsored by the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) for performing a range of hazard analysis, including flood loss and impacts, for a variety of levels of detail regional wherein analysis supported by national databases; and site specific wherein local data be substituted for data that would come from national databases.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:HAZUS a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "HAZUS" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=508" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[HAZUS]" ;
skos:definition "A database and software system sponsored by the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) for performing a range of hazard analysis, including flood loss and impacts, for a variety of levels of detail regional wherein analysis supported by national databases; and site specific wherein local data be substituted for data that would come from national databases." ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;
skos:prefLabel "HAZUS" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Hazard   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Hazard

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Hazard is a leaf node.

Description

Hazard is anything that is a potential source of harm to a valued asset (human, animal, natural, economic, social).

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Hazard_Characterization   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Hazard_Characterization

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Hazard_Characterization is a leaf node.

Description

Hazard Characterization is the qualitative and/or quantitative evaluation of the nature of the adverse effects associated with the identified hazard(s), which may be present in the situation of interest.

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Hazard_potential_classification   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Hazard_potential_classification

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Hazard_potential_classification is a leaf node.

Description

The rating for a dam based on the potential consequences of failure. The rating is based on potential for loss of life and damage to property that failure of that dam could cause. Such classification is related to the amount of development downstream of a dam.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Hazard potential classification" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=507" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Hazard potential classification]" ;
skos:definition "The rating for a dam based on the potential consequences of failure. The rating is based on potential for loss of life and damage to property that failure of that dam could cause. Such classification is related to the amount of development downstream of a dam." ;

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Headrace   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Headrace

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Headrace is a leaf node.

Description

A free-flow tunnel or open channel that conveys water to the upper end of a penstock; hence, the terms 'headrace tunnel' and 'headrace canal'.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .

@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Headrace]" ;

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Heel   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Heel

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Heel is a leaf node.

Description

The junction of the upstream face of a gravity or arch dam with the ground surface. For an embankment dam the junction is referred to as the upstream toe of the dam.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Hollow_jet_valve   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Hollow_jet_valve

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Hollow_jet_valve is a leaf node.

Description

A device for regulating high-pressure outlets. Essentially, it is half a needle valve in which the needle closure member moves upstream toward the inlet end of the valve to shut off flow. As there is no convergence at the outlet end, the flow emerges in the form of an annular cylinder, segmented by several splitter ribs for admitting air into the jet interior to prevent jet instability.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Hollow_jet_valve a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Hollow jet valve" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=525" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Hollow jet valve]" ;
skos:definition "A device for regulating high-pressure outlets. Essentially, it is half a needle valve in which the needle closure member moves upstream toward the inlet end of the valve to shut off flow. As there is no convergence at the outlet end, the flow emerges in the form of an annular cylinder, segmented by several splitter ribs for admitting air into the jet interior to prevent jet instability." ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;
skos:prefLabel "Hollow jet valve" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Incident   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Incident

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Incident is a leaf node.

Description

An event occurrence at a dam that could potentially result in a dam safety issue, such as a spillway flood, seismic event, gate operation failure, etc. that should be documented and trigger an investigation.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Incident a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Incident" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=508" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Incident]" ;
skos:definition "An event occurrence at a dam that could potentially result in a dam safety issue, such as a spillway flood, seismic event, gate operation failure, etc. that should be documented and trigger an investigation." ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;
skos:prefLabel "Incident" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Inclinometer   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Inclinometer

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Inclinometer is a leaf node.

Description

An instrument, usually consisting of a metal or plastic tube inserted in a drill hole and a sensitized monitor either lowered into the tube or fixed within the tube. This measures at different points the tube's inclination to the vertical. By integration, the lateral position at different Levels of the tube may be found relative to a point, usually the top or bottom of the tube, assumed to be fixed. The system may be used to measure settlement during embankment construction (Bartholomew, Murray, and Goins 1987). A reference benchmark is used to establish the top of the inclinometer casing. The instrument probe is lowered to each slip joint in the casing, and the depth to each joint is read directly off the tape. Settlement measurements are made as each section of casing is added during embankment construction.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Inclinometer a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Inclinometer" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=508" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Inclinometer]" ;
skos:definition "An instrument, usually consisting of a metal or plastic tube inserted in a drill hole and a sensitized monitor either lowered into the tube or fixed within the tube. This measures at different points the tube's inclination to the vertical. By integration, the lateral position at different Levels of the tube may be found relative to a point, usually the top or bottom of the tube, assumed to be fixed. The system may be used to measure settlement during embankment construction (Bartholomew, Murray, and Goins 1987). A reference benchmark is used to establish the top of the inclinometer casing. The instrument probe is lowered to each slip joint in the casing, and the depth to each joint is read directly off the tape. Settlement measurements are made as each section of casing is added during embankment construction." ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;
skos:prefLabel "Inclinometer" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Incremental_consequences   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Incremental_consequences

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Incremental_consequences is a leaf node.

Description

Incremental consequences are associated with a failure of the project to provide the planned level of public protection plus any additional risk created by the project due to dam failure. Incremental consequences = (Consequences associated with the estimated performance of the project including failure) - (Consequence associated with the estimated performance of the project hypothetically without failure).

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Incremental_consequences a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Incremental consequences" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=509" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Incremental consequences]" ;
skos:definition "Incremental consequences are associated with a failure of the project to provide the planned level of public protection plus any additional risk created by the project due to dam failure. Incremental consequences = (Consequences associated with the estimated performance of the project including failure) - (Consequence associated with the estimated performance of the project hypothetically without failure)." ;

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Independent_External_Peer_Review_Team   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Independent_External_Peer_Review_Team

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Independent_External_Peer_Review_Team is a leaf node.

Description

A team of experts selected in accordance with Section 2034 and/ Section 2035 of the Water Resources Development Act of 2007 (Public Law 110-114) to review proposed Civil Works projects and projects under construction.

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Independent_Technical_Review_%28ITR%29   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Independent_Technical_Review_%28ITR%29

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Independent_Technical_Review_%28ITR%29 is a leaf node.

Description

A comprehensive independent review of a technical product (design and construction documents). .The ITR was replaced by an ATR level of review in 2009.

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Indirect_Economic_Impacts   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Indirect_Economic_Impacts

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Indirect_Economic_Impacts is a leaf node.

Description

Impacts associated with the destruction of property and the displacement of people due to the failure. The destruction due to the failure flood can have significant impacts on the local and regional economy as businesses at least temporarily close resulting in loss of employment and income. Similarly, economic activity linked to the services provided by the dam will also have consequences. All these indirect losses then have ripple or multiplier effects in the rest of the regional and national economy due to the resulting reduction in spending on goods and services in the region. These losses are the increment to flood losses above those that would have would have occurred had the dam not failed.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Indirect_Economic_Impacts a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Indirect Economic Impacts" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=509" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Indirect Economic Impacts]" ;
skos:definition "Impacts associated with the destruction of property and the displacement of people due to the failure. The destruction due to the failure flood can have significant impacts on the local and regional economy as businesses at least temporarily close resulting in loss of employment and income. Similarly, economic activity linked to the services provided by the dam will also have consequences. All these indirect losses then have ripple or multiplier effects in the rest of the regional and national economy due to the resulting reduction in spending on goods and services in the region. These losses are the increment to flood losses above those that would have would have occurred had the dam not failed." ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;
skos:prefLabel "Indirect Economic Impacts" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Individual_Risk   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Individual_Risk

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Individual_Risk is a leaf node.

Description

The increment of risk imposed on a particular individual by the existence of a hazardous facility. This increment of risk is an addition to the background risk to life, which the person would live with on a daily basis if the facility did not exist. (ANCOLD October 2003) (reference A.130).

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Individual_Risk a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Individual Risk" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=509" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Individual Risk]" ;
skos:definition "The increment of risk imposed on a particular individual by the existence of a hazardous facility. This increment of risk is an addition to the background risk to life, which the person would live with on a daily basis if the facility did not exist. (ANCOLD October 2003) (reference A.130)." ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Individual_incremental_life_safety_tolerable_risk_guideline_%28ANCOLD%29   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Individual_incremental_life_safety_tolerable_risk_guideline_%28ANCOLD%29

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Individual_incremental_life_safety_tolerable_risk_guideline_%28ANCOLD%29 is a leaf node.

Description

For existing dams, the individual risk to the person or group, which is most at risk, should be less than a limit value of 1 in 10,000 per year, except in extraordinary circumstances, following the ANCOLD (2003) (reference A.130) individual life safety risk guideline. For new dams or major augmentations , the individual risk to the person or group, which is most at risk, should be less than a limit value of 1 in 100,000 per year, except in extraordinary circumstances, following the ANCOLD (2003) (reference A.130) individual life safety risk guideline. In the case of existing dams and new dams or major augmentations, individual risks are to be lower than the limit values to an extent determined in accordance with the ALARP principle.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Individual_incremental_life_safety_tolerable_risk_guideline_%28ANCOLD%29 a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Individual incremental life safety tolerable risk guideline (ANCOLD)" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=509" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Individual incremental life safety tolerable risk guideline (ANCOLD)]" ;
skos:altLabel "ANCOLD" ;
skos:definition "For existing dams, the individual risk to the person or group, which is most at risk, should be less than a limit value of 1 in 10,000 per year, except in extraordinary circumstances, following the ANCOLD (2003) (reference A.130) individual life safety risk guideline. For new dams or major augmentations , the individual risk to the person or group, which is most at risk, should be less than a limit value of 1 in 100,000 per year, except in extraordinary circumstances, following the ANCOLD (2003) (reference A.130) individual life safety risk guideline. In the case of existing dams and new dams or major augmentations, individual risks are to be lower than the limit values to an extent determined in accordance with the ALARP principle." ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;
skos:prefLabel "Individual incremental life safety tolerable risk guideline (ANCOLD)" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Initial_reservoir_filling   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Initial_reservoir_filling

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Initial_reservoir_filling is a leaf node.

Description

A deliberate impoundment to meet project purposes (a continuing process as successively higher pools are attained for flood control projects).

Implementation:

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Institute_for_Water_Resources   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Institute_for_Water_Resources

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Institute_for_Water_Resources is a leaf node.

Description

The U.S. Army Engineer Institute for Water Resources (IWR) was formed to provide forward-looking analysis and research in developing planning methodologies to aid the Civil Works program. Since its beginnings in 1969, the Institute was envisioned to provide USACE with long-range planning capabilities to assist in improving the civil works planning process. Today the Institute continues to provide the Civil Works program with a variety of products to enhance the U.S. Army Engineer Institute for Water Resources development planning. IWR is comprised of several semi-independent Centers, and a senior staff of planning and policy experts. See http://www.iwr.usace.army.mil.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Institute_for_Water_Resources a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Institute for Water Resources" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=510" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Institute for Water Resources]" ;
skos:definition "The U.S. Army Engineer Institute for Water Resources (IWR) was formed to provide forward-looking analysis and research in developing planning methodologies to aid the Civil Works program. Since its beginnings in 1969, the Institute was envisioned to provide USACE with long-range planning capabilities to assist in improving the civil works planning process. Today the Institute continues to provide the Civil Works program with a variety of products to enhance the U.S. Army Engineer Institute for Water Resources development planning. IWR is comprised of several semi-independent Centers, and a senior staff of planning and policy experts. See http://www.iwr.usace.army.mil." ;

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Instrumentation   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Instrumentation

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Instrumentation is a leaf node.

Description

An arrangement of devices installed into or near dams (i.e., piezometers, inclinometers, strain gages, measurement points, etc.), which provide for measurements that can be used to evaluate the structural behavior and performance parameters of the structure.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .

@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Instrumentation]" ;

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Intake   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Intake

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Intake is a leaf node.

Description

Any structure in a reservoir, dam, or river through which water can be discharged. Placed at the beginning of an outlet-works waterway (power conduit, water supply conduit), the intake establishes the ultimate drawdown level of the reservoir by the position and size of its opening(s) to the outlet works. The intake may be vertical or inclined towers, drop inlets, or submerged, box-shaped structures.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Intake a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Intake" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=510" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Intake]" ;
skos:definition "Any structure in a reservoir, dam, or river through which water can be discharged. Placed at the beginning of an outlet-works waterway (power conduit, water supply conduit), the intake establishes the ultimate drawdown level of the reservoir by the position and size of its opening(s) to the outlet works. The intake may be vertical or inclined towers, drop inlets, or submerged, box-shaped structures." ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;
skos:prefLabel "Intake" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Intangible_Consequences   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Intangible_Consequences

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Intangible_Consequences is a leaf node.

Description

These are consequences that have no directly observable physical dimensions but exist in the minds, individually and collectively, of those affected. Such consequences are real and can support decisions. Intangible consequences identified in ANCOLD (2003) (reference A.130) include such things as: the grief and loss suffered by relatives and friends of those who die; the impact of multiple deaths on the psyche of the community in which they lived; the stress involved in arranging alternative accommodations and income; the sense of loss by those who enjoyed the natural landscape destroyed; and the fear of lost status and reputation of the dam owning organization and its technical staff (see discussion at paragraph 5.3.10.3 and ANCOLD (2003) (reference A-130). The affect of these intangible consequences can be observed more tangibly in terms of increased mental health expenditures and increased suicides.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Intangible_Consequences a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Intangible Consequences" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=510" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Intangible Consequences]" ;
skos:definition "These are consequences that have no directly observable physical dimensions but exist in the minds, individually and collectively, of those affected. Such consequences are real and can support decisions. Intangible consequences identified in ANCOLD (2003) (reference A.130) include such things as: the grief and loss suffered by relatives and friends of those who die; the impact of multiple deaths on the psyche of the community in which they lived; the stress involved in arranging alternative accommodations and income; the sense of loss by those who enjoyed the natural landscape destroyed; and the fear of lost status and reputation of the dam owning organization and its technical staff (see discussion at paragraph 5.3.10.3 and ANCOLD (2003) (reference A-130). The affect of these intangible consequences can be observed more tangibly in terms of increased mental health expenditures and increased suicides." ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;
skos:prefLabel "Intangible Consequences" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Interagency_Committee_on_Dam_Safety   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Interagency_Committee_on_Dam_Safety

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Interagency_Committee_on_Dam_Safety is a leaf node.

Description

The Interagency Committee on Dam Safety (ICODS) is comprised of a representative of each of the Department of Agriculture, the Department of Defense, the Department of Energy, the Department of the Interior, the Department of Labor, the Federal Emergency Management Agency, the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission, the Nuclear Regulatory Commission, the Tennessee Valley Authority, and the United States Section of the International Boundary Commission. ICODS encourages the establishment and maintenance of effective Federal programs, policies, and guidelines intended to enhance dam safety for the protection of human life and property through coordination and information exchange among Federal agencies concerning implementation of the Federal Guidelines for Dam Safety (reference A.114).

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Interagency_Committee_on_Dam_Safety a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Interagency Committee on Dam Safety" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=510" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Interagency Committee on Dam Safety]" ;
skos:definition "The Interagency Committee on Dam Safety (ICODS) is comprised of a representative of each of the Department of Agriculture, the Department of Defense, the Department of Energy, the Department of the Interior, the Department of Labor, the Federal Emergency Management Agency, the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission, the Nuclear Regulatory Commission, the Tennessee Valley Authority, and the United States Section of the International Boundary Commission. ICODS encourages the establishment and maintenance of effective Federal programs, policies, and guidelines intended to enhance dam safety for the protection of human life and property through coordination and information exchange among Federal agencies concerning implementation of the Federal Guidelines for Dam Safety (reference A.114)." ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;
skos:prefLabel "Interagency Committee on Dam Safety" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Interim_Risk_Reduction_Measure_%28IRRM%29   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Interim_Risk_Reduction_Measure_%28IRRM%29

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Interim_Risk_Reduction_Measure_%28IRRM%29 is a leaf node.

Description

Dam Safety Risk Reduction Measures that are to be formulated and undertaken for dams that are not considered to be tolerably safe and are intended as interim until more permanent remediation measures are implemented. Increased monitoring and reservoir restrictions are examples of interim measures that can be taken at a project.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .

@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Interim_Risk_Reduction_Measures_Plans_%28IRRMP%29   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Interim_Risk_Reduction_Measures_Plans_%28IRRMP%29

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Interim_Risk_Reduction_Measures_Plans_%28IRRMP%29 is a leaf node.

Description

Plans prepared by the districts for all DSAC Class I, 2, and 3 dams. The urgency of submittal corresponds to the DSAC Class. In general, the plans will describe the project and area, dam safety issues, failure modes and analysis, interim risk reduction plans, consequences with and without the plan, schedule, cost, coordination and review documentation, updated emergency action plan, and communications plan.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Interim_Risk_Reduction_Measures_Plans_%28IRRMP%29 a wov:GlossaryTerm,

rdfs:label "Interim Risk Reduction Measures Plans (IRRMP)" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=511" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Interim Risk Reduction Measures Plans (IRRMP)]" ;

In general, the plans will describe the project and area, dam safety issues, failure modes and analysis, interim risk reduction plans, consequences with and without the plan, schedule, cost, coordination and review documentation, updated emergency action plan, and communications plan." ;

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Interlock   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Interlock

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Interlock is a leaf node.

Description

A device for preventing a mechanism from being set in motion when another mechanism is in such a position that the two operating simultaneously might produce undesirable results.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Interlock a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Interlock" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=511" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Interlock]" ;
skos:definition "A device for preventing a mechanism from being set in motion when another mechanism is in such a position that the two operating simultaneously might produce undesirable results." ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;
skos:prefLabel "Interlock" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Internal_Erosion   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Internal_Erosion

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Internal_Erosion is a leaf node.

Description

Internal erosion development leading to dam failure can be represented by four phases: initiation, continuation, progression, and breach.Internal Erosion: Removal of soil particles within an embankment dam or its foundation by seepage or leakage

Implementation:

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Intervention   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Intervention

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Intervention is a leaf node.

Description

An action taken during the sequence of any failure mechanism either when failure has been initiated or later to prevent or delay completion of failure progression.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Intervention a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Intervention" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=511" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Intervention]" ;
skos:definition "An action taken during the sequence of any failure mechanism either when failure has been initiated or later to prevent or delay completion of failure progression." ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;
skos:prefLabel "Intervention" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Inundation_map   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Inundation_map

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Inundation_map is a leaf node.

Description

Inundation Map: A map showing either the actual or predicted extent of flood water within a study area for future pre-determined flood events, ongoing flood events, or past flood events. For dams, a map showing the predicted extent of inundation from controlled or uncontrolled reservoir releases for a pre-determined event scenario or scenarios. Releases may be a result of normal reservoir operation, a result of structural failure or a result of misoperation. An example of a controlled release is flood-inducing spillway discharge. An example of an uncontrolled release is overtopping and/or structural failure. For levees, a map showing the predicted extent of leveed area inundation due to breach of the levee system prior to or during overtopping, levee overtopping without breach, or misoperation of a levee system component for a pre-determined event scenario. An inundation map is sometimes referred to as a flood inundation map. The policy on release of inundation maps is provided in EC 1165-2- 215 (reference A.97).

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Inundation_map a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Inundation map" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=511" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Inundation map]" ;
skos:definition "Inundation Map: A map showing either the actual or predicted extent of flood water within a study area for future pre-determined flood events, ongoing flood events, or past flood events. For dams, a map showing the predicted extent of inundation from controlled or uncontrolled reservoir releases for a pre-determined event scenario or scenarios. Releases may be a result of normal reservoir operation, a result of structural failure or a result of misoperation. An example of a controlled release is flood-inducing spillway discharge. An example of an uncontrolled release is overtopping and/or structural failure. For levees, a map showing the predicted extent of leveed area inundation due to breach of the levee system prior to or during overtopping, levee overtopping without breach, or misoperation of a levee system component for a pre-determined event scenario. An inundation map is sometimes referred to as a flood inundation map. The policy on release of inundation maps is provided in EC 1165-2- 215 (reference A.97)." ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;
skos:prefLabel "Inundation map" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Issue_Evaluation_Studies   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Issue_Evaluation_Studies

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Issue_Evaluation_Studies is a leaf node.

Description

Issue Evaluation studies for dams classified in DSAC Classes 2, 3, and 4 are studies to better determine the nature of the dam safety issue and the degree of urgency for action within the context of the full USACE inventory of dams. The intent of an Issue Evaluation Study is to perform a more robust and detailed level of risk assessment, than used in the SPRA that will enable informed decisions about the need for further investigations, the DSAC classification, and interim risk reduction measures implementation. However the level of detail should only be what is needed to justify the decision to pursue or not to pursue a dam safety modification study.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Issue_Evaluation_Studies a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Issue Evaluation Studies" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=511" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Issue Evaluation Studies]" ;
skos:definition "Issue Evaluation studies for dams classified in DSAC Classes 2, 3, and 4 are studies to better determine the nature of the dam safety issue and the degree of urgency for action within the context of the full USACE inventory of dams. The intent of an Issue Evaluation Study is to perform a more robust and detailed level of risk assessment, than used in the SPRA that will enable informed decisions about the need for further investigations, the DSAC classification, and interim risk reduction measures implementation. However the level of detail should only be what is needed to justify the decision to pursue or not to pursue a dam safety modification study." ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;
skos:prefLabel "Issue Evaluation Studies" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Lead_Engineer   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Lead_Engineer

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Lead_Engineer is a leaf node.

Description

A registered professional engineer (typically a civil, geotechnical, or structural engineer) or engineering geologist qualified through appropriate technical training and experience, assigned the responsibility to lead the technical team members of a product delivery team. The engineering geologist is required to be a registered professional engineer. The lead engineer is responsible for working closely with the Project Manager and insuring that all technical requirements are addressed in the Project Management Plan (PMP). The lead engineer insure that the necessary field investigations are completed during the study and design phases; that plans and specifications are reviewed; that the technical comments on the design are properly addressed; and that engineers on the PDT visit the project during the construction phase. When possible the same individual should function as the lead engineer from the start of the studies until the completion of the project. (See Dam Safety Modification Lead Engineer definition for dam safety modification projects.)

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=512" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Lead Engineer]" ;
skos:definition "A registered professional engineer (typically a civil, geotechnical, or structural engineer) or engineering geologist qualified through appropriate technical training and experience, assigned the responsibility to lead the technical team members of a product delivery team. The engineering geologist is required to be a registered professional engineer. The lead engineer is responsible for working closely with the Project Manager and insuring that all technical requirements are addressed in the Project Management Plan (PMP). The lead engineer insure that the necessary field investigations are completed during the study and design phases; that plans and specifications are reviewed; that the technical comments on the design are properly addressed; and that engineers on the PDT visit the project during the construction phase. When possible the same individual should function as the lead engineer from the start of the studies until the completion of the project. (See Dam Safety Modification Lead Engineer definition for dam safety modification projects.)" ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;
skos:prefLabel "Lead Engineer" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Leakage   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Leakage

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Leakage is a leaf node.

Description

Concentrated flow through preferential paths (e.g., crack in cohesive soil, open rock defect).

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .

@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Length_of_dam   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Length_of_dam

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Length_of_dam is a leaf node.

Description

The length along the top of the dam. This also includes the spillway, power plant, navigation lock, fish pass, etc., where these form part of the length of the dam. If detached from the dam these structures should not be included.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Length_of_dam a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Length of dam" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=512" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Length of dam]" ;
skos:definition "The length along the top of the dam. This also includes the spillway, power plant, navigation lock, fish pass, etc., where these form part of the length of the dam. If detached from the dam these structures should not be included." ;

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Levee   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Levee

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Levee is a leaf node.

Description

An embankment whose primary purpose is to furnish flood protection from seasonal high water. Embankments that are subject to water loading for prolonged periods or permanently should be designed in accordance with earth dam criteria.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Levee a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Levee" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=512" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Levee]" ;
skos:definition "An embankment whose primary purpose is to furnish flood protection from seasonal high water. Embankments that are subject to water loading for prolonged periods or permanently should be designed in accordance with earth dam criteria." ;

    • ER-1110-2-1156:Life_Loss_Consequences

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Life_Loss_Consequences is a leaf node.

Description

This includes the determination of the population at risk, threaten population, and the estimated potential loss of life.

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Life_Loss_Estimates   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Life_Loss_Estimates

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Life_Loss_Estimates is a leaf node.

Description

Estimate of potential life loss using approved life loss estimating methodology. May be for individual failure modes, or combined for a set of potential failure modes for specified loading scenario(s).

Implementation:

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Life_Safety_Tolerable_Risk_Guidelines   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Life_Safety_Tolerable_Risk_Guidelines

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Life_Safety_Tolerable_Risk_Guidelines is a leaf node.

Description

Three types of life safety tolerable risk guidelines will be used under the USACE tolerable risk guidelines. Individual incremental life safety risk using probability of life loss and Societal incremental life safety risk express in two different ways - Probability distribution of potential life loss (F- Nchart);andthef-NÌ… withaverageannualLifeLoss(AALL).

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

rdfs:label "Life Safety Tolerable Risk Guidelines" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=512" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Life Safety Tolerable Risk Guidelines]" ;
skos:definition "Three types of life safety tolerable risk guidelines will be used under the USACE tolerable risk guidelines. Individual incremental life safety risk using probability of life loss and Societal incremental life safety risk express in two different ways - Probability distribution of potential life loss (F- Nchart);andthef-NÌ… withaverageannualLifeLoss(AALL)." ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;
skos:prefLabel "Life Safety Tolerable Risk Guidelines" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Liquefaction   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Liquefaction

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Liquefaction is a leaf node.

Description

A condition whereby soil undergoes continued deformation at a constant low residual stress or with low residual resistance, due to the buildup and maintenance of high pore water pressures, which reduces the effective confining pressure to a very low value. Pore pressure buildup leading to liquefaction may be due either to static or cyclic stress applications and the possibility of its occurrence will depend on the void ratio or relative density of a cohesionless or slightly cohesive soil and the confining pressure.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Liquefaction a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Liquefaction" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=513" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Liquefaction]" ;
skos:definition "A condition whereby soil undergoes continued deformation at a constant low residual stress or with low residual resistance, due to the buildup and maintenance of high pore water pressures, which reduces the effective confining pressure to a very low value. Pore pressure buildup leading to liquefaction may be due either to static or cyclic stress applications and the possibility of its occurrence will depend on the void ratio or relative density of a cohesionless or slightly cohesive soil and the confining pressure." ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;
skos:prefLabel "Liquefaction" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Locally_Controlled_System   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Locally_Controlled_System

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Locally_Controlled_System is a leaf node.

Description

A locally controlled system is a system where operation is made by personnel physically located at the project site using controls that are physically located at the structure being operated.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .

@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:National_Dam_Safety_Review_Board   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:National_Dam_Safety_Review_Board

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:National_Dam_Safety_Review_Board is a leaf node.

Description

The National Dam Safety Review Board provides the Director of FEMA with advice in setting national dam safety priorities and considers the effects of national policy issues affecting dam safety. Review Board members include FEMA, the Chair of the Board; representatives from four federal agencies that serve on the Interagency Committee on Dam Safety (ICODS); five state dam safety officials; and one member from the private sector.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:National_Dam_Safety_Review_Board a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "National Dam Safety Review Board" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=513" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[National Dam Safety Review Board]" ;
skos:definition "The National Dam Safety Review Board provides the Director of FEMA with advice in setting national dam safety priorities and considers the effects of national policy issues affecting dam safety. Review Board members include FEMA, the Chair of the Board; representatives from four federal agencies that serve on the Interagency Committee on Dam Safety (ICODS); five state dam safety officials; and one member from the private sector." ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;
skos:prefLabel "National Dam Safety Review Board" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:National_Environmental_Policy_Act_%28NEPA%29   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:National_Environmental_Policy_Act_%28NEPA%29

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:National_Environmental_Policy_Act_%28NEPA%29 is a leaf node.

Description

The National Environmental Policy Act (NEPA) (reference A.6) requires federal agencies to integrate environmental values into their decision making processes by considering the environmental impacts of their proposed actions and reasonable alternatives to those actions. To meet NEPA requirements federal agencies prepare a detailed statement known as an Environmental Impact Statement (EIS). EPA reviews and comments on EIS's prepared by other federal agencies, maintains a national filing system for all EIS's, and assures that its own actions comply with NEPA.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:National_Environmental_Policy_Act_%28NEPA%29 a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "National Environmental Policy Act (NEPA)" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=514" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[National Environmental Policy Act (NEPA)]" ;
skos:altLabel "NEPA" ;
skos:definition "The National Environmental Policy Act (NEPA) (reference A.6) requires federal agencies to integrate environmental values into their decision making processes by considering the environmental impacts of their proposed actions and reasonable alternatives to those actions. To meet NEPA requirements federal agencies prepare a detailed statement known as an Environmental Impact Statement (EIS). EPA reviews and comments on EIS's prepared by other federal agencies, maintains a national filing system for all EIS's, and assures that its own actions comply with NEPA." ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;
skos:prefLabel "National Environmental Policy Act (NEPA)" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:National_Inventory_of_Dams   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:National_Inventory_of_Dams

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:National_Inventory_of_Dams is a leaf node.

Description

The National Inventory of Dams (NID) contains information on approximately 84,000 dams throughout the U.S. that are more than 25 feet high, hold more than 50 acre-feet of water, or are considered a significant hazard if they fail. The NID is maintained and published by USACE with information from all 50 states, Puerto Rico, and 16 Federal agencies. The NID is available on the web athttp://geo.usace.army.mil/pgis/f?p=397:12:0

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:National_Inventory_of_Dams a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "National Inventory of Dams" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=514" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[National Inventory of Dams]" ;
skos:definition "The National Inventory of Dams (NID) contains information on approximately 84,000 dams throughout the U.S. that are more than 25 feet high, hold more than 50 acre-feet of water, or are considered a significant hazard if they fail. The NID is maintained and published by USACE with information from all 50 states, Puerto Rico, and 16 Federal agencies. The NID is available on the web athttp://geo.usace.army.mil/pgis/f?p=397:12:0" ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;
skos:prefLabel "National Inventory of Dams" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Normal_Operations   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Normal_Operations

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Normal_Operations is a leaf node.

Description

Loading on the dam resulting from day-to-day pool operations to achieve authorized purposes. (For the purposes of a screening analysis for dry dams, or where pool elevations fluctuate widely and no historical normal pool elevation has been established, the normal loading is usually correlated to a 1 to 10 year return period.)

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Normal_Operations a wov:GlossaryTerm,

rdfs:label "Normal Operations" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=514" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Normal Operations]" ;
skos:definition "Loading on the dam resulting from day-to-day pool operations to achieve authorized purposes. Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Parametric_Studies   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Parametric_Studies

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Parametric_Studies is a leaf node.

Description

Parametric studies execute one application many times with different sets of input parameters. Such studies are in-effect, systematic, carefully controlled sensitivity studies.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .

@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Parametric Studies]" ;
