Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Parapet_wall   back to top

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Parapet_wall is a leaf node.

Description

A solid wall built along the top of a dam (upstream or downstream edge) used for ornamentation, for safety of vehicles and pedestrians, or to prevent overtopping caused by wave run-up.

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Peer_Review   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Peer_Review

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Peer_Review is a leaf node.

Description

Peer review is a form of deliberation involving an exchange of judgments about the appropriateness of methods and the strength of the author's inferences. Peer review involves the review of a draft product for quality by specialists in the field who were not involved in producing the draft.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Peer_Review a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Peer Review" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=515" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Peer Review]" ;
skos:definition "Peer review is a form of deliberation involving an exchange of judgments about the appropriateness of methods and the strength of the author's inferences. Peer review involves the review of a draft product for quality by specialists in the field who were not involved in producing the draft." ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;
skos:prefLabel "Peer Review" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Peer_Review_Panel   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Peer_Review_Panel

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Peer_Review_Panel is a leaf node.

Description

A panel of peer experts, usually formed by a district, to review and to advise on particular difficult or controversial technical issues related to a dam safety study. The peer group may be from inside or outside USACE, or whatever combination of experts is judged to best fit the need.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Peer_Review_Panel a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Peer Review Panel" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=515" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Peer Review Panel]" ;
skos:definition "A panel of peer experts, usually formed by a district, to review and to advise on particular difficult or controversial technical issues related to a dam safety study. The peer group may be from inside or outside USACE, or whatever combination of experts is judged to best fit the need." ;

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Performance_Uncertainty   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Performance_Uncertainty

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Performance_Uncertainty is a leaf node.

Description

Performance uncertainty refers to the situation in which more rigorous and detailed studies are needed to more accurately predict the system response probabilities within each applicable failure mode.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Performance_Uncertainty a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Performance Uncertainty" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=515" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Performance Uncertainty]" ;
skos:definition "Performance uncertainty refers to the situation in which more rigorous and detailed studies are needed to more accurately predict the system response probabilities within each applicable failure mode." ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;
skos:prefLabel "Performance Uncertainty" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Periodic_Assessments_%28PA%29   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Periodic_Assessments_%28PA%29

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Periodic_Assessments_%28PA%29 is a leaf node.

Description

The periodic assessment will consist of a site visit, typically associated with a periodic inspection, a potential failure modes analysis, and a semi- quantitative risk assessment based on existing data and limited development of estimated consequence data developed by the Modeling, Mapping, and Consequence Production Center. The primary purposes of the Periodic Assessment are as follows: Evaluate the project vulnerabilities and associated risks, including non-breach risks; Reevaluate the DSAC of a project and recommend a change, if necessary; Review and if necessary revise the IRRMP; Identify the need for issue evaluation studies and provide data to prioritize issue evaluation studies; Identify and prioritize any data collection, analyses, and study needs; Identify operations and maintenance, monitoring, emergency action plan, training and other recurrent needs ; and Provide a better understanding of vulnerabilities and a basis for future dam safety inspections and activities.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Periodic_Assessments_%28PA%29 a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Periodic Assessments (PA)" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=515" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Periodic Assessments (PA)]" ;
skos:altLabel "PA" ;
skos:definition "The periodic assessment will consist of a site visit, typically associated with a periodic inspection, a potential failure modes analysis, and a semi- quantitative risk assessment based on existing data and limited development of estimated consequence data developed by the Modeling, Mapping, and Consequence Production Center. The primary purposes of the Periodic Assessment are as follows: Evaluate the project vulnerabilities and associated risks, including non-breach risks; Reevaluate the DSAC of a project and recommend a change, if necessary; Review and if necessary revise the IRRMP; Identify the need for issue evaluation studies and provide data to prioritize issue evaluation studies; Identify and prioritize any data collection, analyses, and study needs; Identify operations and maintenance, monitoring, emergency action plan, training and other recurrent needs ; and Provide a better understanding of vulnerabilities and a basis for future dam safety inspections and activities." ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;
skos:prefLabel "Periodic Assessments (PA)" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Periodic_Inspections_%28PI%29   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Periodic_Inspections_%28PI%29

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Periodic_Inspections_%28PI%29 is a leaf node.

Description

The recurrent engineering inspections conducted at dams and other civil works structures whose failure or partial failure could jeopardize the operational integrity of the project, endanger the lives and safety of the public or cause substantial property damage must be periodically inspected and evaluated to ensure their structural stability, safety, and operational adequacy.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Periodic_Inspections_%28PI%29 a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Periodic Inspections (PI)" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=515" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Periodic Inspections (PI)]" ;
skos:altLabel "PI" ;
skos:definition "The recurrent engineering inspections conducted at dams and other civil works structures whose failure or partial failure could jeopardize the operational integrity of the project, endanger the lives and safety of the public or cause substantial property damage must be periodically inspected and evaluated to ensure their structural stability, safety, and operational adequacy." ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;
skos:prefLabel "Periodic Inspections (PI)" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Portfolio_Risk_Management_Process   back to top

  • skos:Concept

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Portfolio_Risk_Management_Process is a leaf node.

Description

The management process shown generally on Figure 2.3 and in detail for USACE Figure 3.1. It is a risk-informed USACE-wide portfolio perspective process applied to all features of all dams on a continuing basis. Same definition as 'Dam Safety Portfolio Risk Management Process" above.

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Potential_Failure_Mode_%28PFM%29   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Potential_Failure_Mode_%28PFM%29

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Potential_Failure_Mode_%28PFM%29 is a leaf node.

Description

The chain of events leading to dam failure or a portion there of that could lead to dam failure. The dam does not have to completely fail in the sense of a complete release of the impounded water.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Potential_Failure_Mode_%28PFM%29 a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Potential Failure Mode (PFM)" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=516" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Potential Failure Mode (PFM)]" ;
skos:altLabel "PFM" ;
skos:definition "The chain of events leading to dam failure or a portion there of that could lead to dam failure. The dam does not have to completely fail in the sense of a complete release of the impounded water." ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;
skos:prefLabel "Potential Failure Mode (PFM)" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Potential_Failure_Mode_Analysis_%28PFMA%29   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Potential_Failure_Mode_Analysis_%28PFMA%29

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Potential_Failure_Mode_Analysis_%28PFMA%29 is a leaf node.

Description

A PFMA is an examination of potential failure modes for an existing dam by a team of persons who are qualified either by experience and\or education to evaluate dams. It is based on a review of existing data and information, first hand input from field and operational personnel, site inspection, completed engineering analyses, discussion of dam characteristics, failure causes and an understanding of the consequences of failure. The PFMA is intended to provide enhanced understanding and insight on the risk exposure associated with the dam or levee.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Potential_Failure_Mode_Analysis_%28PFMA%29 a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Potential Failure Mode Analysis (PFMA)" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=516" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Potential Failure Mode Analysis (PFMA)]" ;
skos:altLabel "PFMA" ;
skos:definition "A PFMA is an examination of potential failure modes for an existing dam by a team of persons who are qualified either by experience and\\or education to evaluate dams. It is based on a review of existing data and information, first hand input from field and operational personnel, site inspection, completed engineering analyses, discussion of dam characteristics, failure causes and an understanding of the consequences of failure. The PFMA is intended to provide enhanced understanding and insight on the risk exposure associated with the dam or levee." ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;
skos:prefLabel "Potential Failure Mode Analysis (PFMA)" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Probability   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Probability

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Probability is a leaf node.

Description

A measure, of the likelihood, chance, or degree of belief that a particular outcome or consequence will occur. A probability provides a quantitative description of the likelihood of occurrence of a particular event. This is expressed as a value between 0 and 1. (USACE)

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .

@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Probability]" ;
skos:definition "A measure, of the likelihood, chance, or degree of belief that a particular outcome or consequence will occur. A probability provides a quantitative description of the likelihood of occurrence of a particular event. This is expressed as a value between 0 and 1. (USACE)" ;

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Probability_of_Failure   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Probability_of_Failure

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Probability_of_Failure is a leaf node.

Description

The probability that a component of a dam or the dam will fail, given a specified load, leading to sudden, rapid, and uncontrolled release of impounded water.

@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=516" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Probability of Failure]" ;

skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Probability_of_Individual_Life_Loss   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Probability_of_Individual_Life_Loss

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Probability_of_Individual_Life_Loss is a leaf node.

Description

The probability of individual life loss, which is used in the evaluation of Individual incremental life safety risk, is not necessarily the same as the probability of failure that is used in the evaluation of Reclamation's APF guideline. The probability of life loss is based on the probability of failure and a consideration of exposure factors such as day-night differences in PAR and evaluation and the seasonal presence of people in campgrounds. The level of detail that is appropriate for characterizing exposure factors should be decision driven, although it is noted that FEMA's HAZUS data base provides opportunity for some level of automation in capturing information on exposure factors. The distinction between probability of failure and probability of life loss is particularly important for navigation dams, but can also have a significant effect on the evaluation of life safety for other types of dams. It applies to societal risk as well as to individual risk.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Probability_of_Individual_Life_Loss a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Probability of Individual Life Loss" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=516" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Probability of Individual Life Loss]" ;
skos:definition "The probability of individual life loss, which is used in the evaluation of Individual incremental life safety risk, is not necessarily the same as the probability of failure that is used in the evaluation of Reclamation's APF guideline. The probability of life loss is based on the probability of failure and a consideration of exposure factors such as day-night differences in PAR and evaluation and the seasonal presence of people in campgrounds. The level of detail that is appropriate for characterizing exposure factors should be decision driven, although it is noted that FEMA's HAZUS data base provides opportunity for some level of automation in capturing information on exposure factors. The distinction between probability of failure and probability of life loss is particularly important for navigation dams, but can also have a significant effect on the evaluation of life safety for other types of dams. It applies to societal risk as well as to individual risk." ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;
skos:prefLabel "Probability of Individual Life Loss" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Probable_Maximum_Precipitation_%28PMP%29   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Probable_Maximum_Precipitation_%28PMP%29

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Probable_Maximum_Precipitation_%28PMP%29 is a leaf node.

Description

Theoretically, the greatest depth of precipitation for a given duration that is physically possible over a given size storm area at a particular geographical location.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Probable_Maximum_Precipitation_%28PMP%29 a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Probable Maximum Precipitation (PMP)" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=517" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Probable Maximum Precipitation (PMP)]" ;
skos:altLabel "PMP" ;
skos:definition "Theoretically, the greatest depth of precipitation for a given duration that is physically possible over a given size storm area at a particular geographical location." ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;
skos:prefLabel "Probable Maximum Precipitation (PMP)" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Pumped_storage_reservoir   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Pumped_storage_reservoir

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Pumped_storage_reservoir is a leaf node.

Description

A reservoir filled entirely or mainly with water pumped from outside its natural drainage area.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Pumped_storage_reservoir a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Pumped storage reservoir" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=517" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Pumped storage reservoir]" ;
skos:definition "A reservoir filled entirely or mainly with water pumped from outside its natural drainage area." ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;
skos:prefLabel "Pumped storage reservoir" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Rapid_Consequence_Analysis%2FEstimate   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Rapid_Consequence_Analysis%2FEstimate

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Rapid_Consequence_Analysis%2FEstimate is a leaf node.

Description

The rapid consequence estimate requires a very limited detail, unsteady-flow hydraulic model to reproduce various, with and without, dam failure scenarios. These failure scenarios would include sunny day, Probably Maximum Flood (PMF) and several intermediate load cases between these extremes for both the with and without dam failure condition.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Rapid_Consequence_Analysis%2FEstimate a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Rapid Consequence Analysis/Estimate" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=517" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Rapid Consequence Analysis/Estimate]" ;
skos:definition "The rapid consequence estimate requires a very limited detail, unsteady-flow hydraulic model to reproduce various, with and without, dam failure scenarios. These failure scenarios would include sunny day, Probably Maximum Flood (PMF) and several intermediate load cases between these extremes for both the with and without dam failure condition." ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;
skos:prefLabel "Rapid Consequence Analysis/Estimate" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Redundancy   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Redundancy

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Redundancy is a leaf node.

Description

The duplication of critical components of a system with the intention of increasing reliability of the system, usually in the case of a backup or fail-safe.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .

@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .

@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

skos:Concept ;

pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Redundancy]" ;
skos:definition "The duplication of critical components of a system with the intention of increasing reliability of the system, usually in the case of a backup or fail-safe." ;

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Regional_Cadres   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Regional_Cadres

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Regional_Cadres is a leaf node.

Description

Teams of technical specialists and analysts (cadre) assembled to conduct project specific risk evaluations, such as PFMAs, based on expert knowledge of the geology, hydrology, structural integrity, soils, consequences, and other relevant factors.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .

@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Regional_Cadres a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Regional Cadres" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=517" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Regional Cadres]" ;
skos:definition "Teams of technical specialists and analysts (cadre) assembled to conduct project specific risk evaluations, such as PFMAs, based on expert knowledge of the geology, hydrology, structural integrity, soils, consequences, and other relevant factors." ;

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Regulating_sleeve_valve   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Regulating_sleeve_valve

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Regulating_sleeve_valve is a leaf node.

Description

A valve for regulating high-pressure outlets and ensuring energy dissipation. Inside the valve there is a fixed-cone, pointed upstream, which ensures dispersion of the jet. Outside the valve a cylindrical sleeve moves downstream to shut off flow by sealing on the periphery of the cone.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Regulating_sleeve_valve a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Regulating sleeve valve" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=525" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Regulating sleeve valve]" ;
skos:definition "A valve for regulating high-pressure outlets and ensuring energy dissipation. Inside the valve there is a fixed-cone, pointed upstream, which ensures dispersion of the jet. Outside the valve a cylindrical sleeve moves downstream to shut off flow by sealing on the periphery of the cone." ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;
skos:prefLabel "Regulating sleeve valve" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Regulation_Design_Capacity   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Regulation_Design_Capacity

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Regulation_Design_Capacity is a leaf node.

Description

The maximum hydrologic loading condition (flood hydrograph) above which the project no longer has storage capacity to reduce flow that would provide flood damage reduction benefits. The regulation design capacity is typically the reservoir storage capacity (and attendant operation rules and policies) that are authorized for a flood damage reduction reservoir project. This will always be a hydrologic loading level less than the loading levels used as the structural design capacity.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Regulation_Design_Capacity a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Regulation Design Capacity" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=517" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Regulation Design Capacity]" ;
skos:definition "The maximum hydrologic loading condition (flood hydrograph) above which the project no longer has storage capacity to reduce flow that would provide flood damage reduction benefits. The regulation design capacity is typically the reservoir storage capacity (and attendant operation rules and policies) that are authorized for a flood damage reduction reservoir project. This will always be a hydrologic loading level less than the loading levels used as the structural design capacity." ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;
skos:prefLabel "Regulation Design Capacity" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Reliability   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Reliability

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Reliability is a leaf node.

Description

For gate and mechanical systems reliability is defined as the likelihood of successful performance of a given project element. It may be measured on an annual basis or for some specified time period of interest or, for example, in the case of spillway gates, on a per demand basis. Mathematically, Reliability = 1 - Probability of unsatisfactory operation.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Reliability a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Reliability" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=518" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Reliability]" ;
skos:definition "For gate and mechanical systems reliability is defined as the likelihood of successful performance of a given project element. It may be measured on an annual basis or for some specified time period of interest or, for example, in the case of spillway gates, on a per demand basis. Mathematically, Reliability = 1 - Probability of unsatisfactory operation." ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;
skos:prefLabel "Reliability" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Remotely_Controlled_System   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Remotely_Controlled_System

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Remotely_Controlled_System is a leaf node.

Description

A remotely controlled system is a system where operation is made by personnel who are physically located at the project site using remote controls that are not physically at the structure being operated.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Remotely_Controlled_System a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Remotely Controlled System" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=518" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Remotely Controlled System]" ;
skos:definition "A remotely controlled system is a system where operation is made by personnel who are physically located at the project site using remote controls that are not physically at the structure being operated." ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;
skos:prefLabel "Remotely Controlled System" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Reservoir   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Reservoir

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Reservoir is a leaf node.

Description

A body of water impounded by a dam and in which water can be stored.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .

@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

skos:Concept ;

dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=518" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Reservoir]" ;
skos:definition "A body of water impounded by a dam and in which water can be stored." ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;
skos:prefLabel "Reservoir" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Reservoir_capacity   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Reservoir_capacity

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Reservoir_capacity is a leaf node.

Description

The sum of the dead and live storage of the reservoir.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Reservoir_capacity a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Reservoir capacity" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=523" ;

skos:definition "The sum of the dead and live storage of the reservoir." ;

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Riprap   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Riprap

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Riprap is a leaf node.

Description

A layer of large uncoursed stone, precast blocks, bags of cement, or other suitable material, generally placed on the upstream slopes of an embankment or along a watercourse as protection against wave action, erosion, or scour. Riprap is usually placed by dumping or other mechanical methods and in some cases is hand placed. It consists of pieces of relatively large size as distinguished from a gravel blanket. Also known as stone slope protection.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Riprap a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Riprap" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=518" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Riprap]" ;
skos:definition "A layer of large uncoursed stone, precast blocks, bags of cement, or other suitable material, generally placed on the upstream slopes of an embankment or along a watercourse as protection against wave action, erosion, or scour. Riprap is usually placed by dumping or other mechanical methods and in some cases is hand placed. It consists of pieces of relatively large size as distinguished from a gravel blanket. Also known as stone slope protection." ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;
skos:prefLabel "Riprap" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Risk_Characterization   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Risk_Characterization

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Risk_Characterization is a leaf node.

Description

Risk characterization is the qualitative or quantitative description of the nature, magnitude and likelihood of the adverse effects associated with a hazard with and without a risk management action. A risk characterization often includes: one or more estimates of risk; risk descriptions; evaluations of risk management options; economic and other evaluations; estimates of changes in risk attributable to the management options.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Risk_Characterization a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Risk Characterization" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=519" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Risk Characterization]" ;
skos:definition "Risk characterization is the qualitative or quantitative description of the nature, magnitude and likelihood of the adverse effects associated with a hazard with and without a risk management action. A risk characterization often includes: one or more estimates of risk; risk descriptions; evaluations of risk management options; economic and other evaluations; estimates of changes in risk attributable to the management options." ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;
skos:prefLabel "Risk Characterization" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Risk_Communication   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Risk_Communication

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Risk_Communication is a leaf node.

Description

Risk communication is the open, two-way exchange of information and opinion about hazards and risks leading to a better understanding of the risks and better risk management decisions.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Risk_Engine   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Risk_Engine

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Risk_Engine is a leaf node.

Description

Software and computational algorithms either commercially available or under development by USACE that is used to construct an event tree for a plausible failure mode and automatically calculate the estimated risk.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .

@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Risk_Engine a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Risk Engine" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=519" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Risk Engine]" ;
skos:definition "Software and computational algorithms either commercially available or under development by USACE that is used to construct an event tree for a plausible failure mode and automatically calculate the estimated risk." ;

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Risk_Management_Center_%28RMC%29   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Risk_Management_Center_%28RMC%29

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Risk_Management_Center_%28RMC%29 is a leaf node.

Description

An independent USACE Center assigned to the Institute for Water Resources, which is responsible for development and implementation of dam and levee safety policy, prioritization of national dam and levee safety projects and technical consistency of dam and levee safety products. The Center utilizes a combination of in-situ and virtual resources (district, contract, the Modeling, Mapping, and Consequence Production Center, and Policy and Procedures workgroups) to manage the program.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Risk_Management_Center_%28RMC%29 a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Risk Management Center (RMC)" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=519" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Risk Management Center (RMC)]" ;
skos:altLabel "RMC" ;
skos:definition "An independent USACE Center assigned to the Institute for Water Resources, which is responsible for development and implementation of dam and levee safety policy, prioritization of national dam and levee safety projects and technical consistency of dam and levee safety products. The Center utilizes a combination of in-situ and virtual resources (district, contract, the Modeling, Mapping, and Consequence Production Center, and Policy and Procedures workgroups) to manage the program." ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;
skos:prefLabel "Risk Management Center (RMC)" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Risk_assessment   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Risk_assessment

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Risk_assessment is a leaf node.

Description

Risk assessment is a broad term that encompasses a variety of analytic techniques that are used in different situations, depending upon the nature of the risk, the available data, and needs of decision makers. A risk assessment is a systematic, evidence based approach for quantifying and describing the nature, likelihood, and magnitude of risk associated with the current condition and the same values resulting from a changed condition due to some action. Risk assessment includes explicit acknowledgment of the uncertainties in the risk. As applied to dam safety, the process of identifying the likelihood and consequences of dam failure to provide the basis for informed decisions on a course of action.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Risk_assessment a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Risk assessment" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=518" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Risk assessment]" ;
skos:definition "Risk assessment is a broad term that encompasses a variety of analytic techniques that are used in different situations, depending upon the nature of the risk, the available data, and needs of decision makers. A risk assessment is a systematic, evidence based approach for quantifying and describing the nature, likelihood, and magnitude of risk associated with the current condition and the same values resulting from a changed condition due to some action. Risk assessment includes explicit acknowledgment of the uncertainties in the risk. As applied to dam safety, the process of identifying the likelihood and consequences of dam failure to provide the basis for informed decisions on a course of action." ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;
skos:prefLabel "Risk assessment" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Risk_management   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Risk_management

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Risk_management is a leaf node.

Description

Risk management is the process of problem finding and initiating action to identify, evaluate, select, implement, monitor and modify actions taken to alter levels of risk, as compared to taking no action. The purpose of risk management is to choose and prioritize work required to reduce risk.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Risk_management a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Risk management" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=519" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Risk management]" ;
skos:definition "Risk management is the process of problem finding and initiating action to identify, evaluate, select, implement, monitor and modify actions taken to alter levels of risk, as compared to taking no action. The purpose of risk management is to choose and prioritize work required to reduce risk." ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;
skos:prefLabel "Risk management" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Risk_to_Tolerable_Levels   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Risk_to_Tolerable_Levels

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Risk_to_Tolerable_Levels is a leaf node.

Description

In context, this refers to implementing dam safety risk reduction measures such that the resulting risk is 'tolerable' as shown graphically in figure 5.1. Generally is the outcome of application of the ALARP (As Low As Reasonably Possible) considerations.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Risk_to_Tolerable_Levels a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Risk to Tolerable Levels" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=519" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Risk to Tolerable Levels]" ;
skos:definition "In context, this refers to implementing dam safety risk reduction measures such that the resulting risk is 'tolerable' as shown graphically in figure 5.1. Generally is the outcome of application of the ALARP (As Low As Reasonably Possible) considerations." ;

skos:prefLabel "Risk to Tolerable Levels" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Robustness   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Robustness

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Robustness is a leaf node.

Description

Robustness is the ability of a system to continue to operate correctly across a wide range of operational conditions, with minimal damage, alteration or loss of functionality, and to fail gracefully outside of that range. The wider the range of conditions included, the more robust the system.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Robustness a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Robustness" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=520" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Robustness]" ;
skos:definition "Robustness is the ability of a system to continue to operate correctly across a wide range of operational conditions, with minimal damage, alteration or loss of functionality, and to fail gracefully outside of that range. The wider the range of conditions included, the more robust the system." ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;
skos:prefLabel "Robustness" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Rock_anchor   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Rock_anchor

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Rock_anchor is a leaf node.

Description

A steel rod or cable placed in a hole drilled in rock, held in position by grout, mechanical means, or both. In principle, the same as a rock bolt, but usually the rock anchor is more than 4 meters long.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Rock_anchor a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Rock anchor" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=520" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Rock anchor]" ;
skos:definition "A steel rod or cable placed in a hole drilled in rock, held in position by grout, mechanical means, or both. In principle, the same as a rock bolt, but usually the rock anchor is more than 4 meters long." ;

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Safety   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Safety

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Safety is a leaf node.

Description

Safety is thought of as the condition of being free from danger, risk, or injury. However, safety is not something that can be absolutely achieved or guaranteed. Instead safety is the condition to which risks are managed to acceptable levels. Therefore, safety is a subjective concept based on individual perceptions of risks and their tolerability

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Safety a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Safety" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=520" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Safety]" ;
skos:definition "Safety is thought of as the condition of being free from danger, risk, or injury. However, safety is not something that can be absolutely achieved or guaranteed. Instead safety is the condition to which risks are managed to acceptable levels. Therefore, safety is a subjective concept based on individual perceptions of risks and their tolerability" ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;
skos:prefLabel "Safety" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Safety_Assurance_Review_Team   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Safety_Assurance_Review_Team

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Safety_Assurance_Review_Team is a leaf node.

Description

Section 2035, Safety assurance review team, Public Law 110-114, the Water Resource Development Act of 2007, requires a safety assurance review of the design and construction of work effecting public safety. This review team is formed at the time pre-construction engineering and design starts and stays with the project until the completion of construction.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Safety_Assurance_Review_Team a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Safety Assurance Review Team" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=520" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Safety Assurance Review Team]" ;
skos:definition "Section 2035, Safety assurance review team, Public Law 110-114, the Water Resource Development Act of 2007, requires a safety assurance review of the design and construction of work effecting public safety. This review team is formed at the time pre-construction engineering and design starts and stays with the project until the completion of construction." ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;
skos:prefLabel "Safety Assurance Review Team" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Screening_for_Portfolio_Risk_Analysis_%28SPRA%29   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Screening_for_Portfolio_Risk_Analysis_%28SPRA%29

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Screening_for_Portfolio_Risk_Analysis_%28SPRA%29 is a leaf node.

Description

This analysis screened projects based on available information, to expeditiously identify the highest risk dams requiring urgent and compelling action (Dam Safety Action Classification 1 and 2 Dams) with low chance of missing any such dams Also, the SPRA is to provide information for preliminary classification of the remainder of the USACE dams into Dam Safety Action Classes 3 - 4. SPRA does not provide sufficient information to confirm whether a dam can be placed in Dam Safety Action Classification Class 5. SPRA will be performed only once for every dam in the USACE inventory. Risk estimates that are computed from SPRA are a relative measure only to compare dams across the USACE portfolio. Decisions and actions relative to tolerable risk cannot be made solely from SPRA results.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Screening_for_Portfolio_Risk_Analysis_%28SPRA%29 a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Screening for Portfolio Risk Analysis (SPRA)" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=520" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Screening for Portfolio Risk Analysis (SPRA)]" ;
skos:altLabel "SPRA" ;
skos:definition "This analysis screened projects based on available information, to expeditiously identify the highest risk dams requiring urgent and compelling action (Dam Safety Action Classification 1 and 2 Dams) with low chance of missing any such dams Also, the SPRA is to provide information for preliminary classification of the remainder of the USACE dams into Dam Safety Action Classes 3 - 4. SPRA does not provide sufficient information to confirm whether a dam can be placed in Dam Safety Action Classification Class 5. SPRA will be performed only once for every dam in the USACE inventory. Risk estimates that are computed from SPRA are a relative measure only to compare dams across the USACE portfolio. Decisions and actions relative to tolerable risk cannot be made solely from SPRA results." ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;
skos:prefLabel "Screening for Portfolio Risk Analysis (SPRA)" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Section_1203_-_Dam_Safety_Assurance_Cost_Sharing   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Section_1203_-_Dam_Safety_Assurance_Cost_Sharing

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Section_1203_-_Dam_Safety_Assurance_Cost_Sharing is a leaf node.

Description

Section 1203, WRDA, 1986 (reference A.12) provides for special cost-sharing for modification of completed USACE dam projects that are potential safety hazards in light of current engineering standards and criteria. The problems that meet the criteria of Section 1203 fall into three main categories: hydrologic, seismic, and change in state-of-the-art. (Modifications required on a project due to state-of-the-art changes, but not related to hydrologic or seismic deficiencies, must be decided on a case-by-case basis by the ASA(CW). Costs incurred in modifications for dam safety assurance must be recovered in accordance with provisions of the statute.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Section_1203_-_Dam_Safety_Assurance_Cost_Sharing a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Section 1203 - Dam Safety Assurance Cost Sharing" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=520" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Section 1203 - Dam Safety Assurance Cost Sharing]" ;
skos:definition "Section 1203, WRDA, 1986 (reference A.12) provides for special cost-sharing for modification of completed USACE dam projects that are potential safety hazards in light of current engineering standards and criteria. The problems that meet the criteria of Section 1203 fall into three main categories: hydrologic, seismic, and change in state-of-the-art. (Modifications required on a project due to state-of-the-art changes, but not related to hydrologic or seismic deficiencies, must be decided on a case-by-case basis by the ASA(CW). Costs incurred in modifications for dam safety assurance must be recovered in accordance with provisions of the statute." ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;
skos:prefLabel "Section 1203 - Dam Safety Assurance Cost Sharing" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Significant_Failure_Modes   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Significant_Failure_Modes

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Significant_Failure_Modes is a leaf node.

Description

Significant failure modes are a subset of credible failure modes (i.e. physically possible). The term significant should be judged in the context of the purpose of the risk assessment and the decisions that it will inform. Factors to consider include Dam Safety Action Classification, comparisons with tolerable risk guidelines, scoping the next level of study, portfolio roll-up of the risk estimates, the level of confidence in risk estimates, representation of uncertainty in estimates, and prioritization for next phase of work. For example credible failure mode should be considered significant if the probability of failure and associated consequences approach closely or exceed a tolerable risk limit guideline.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Significant_Failure_Modes a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Significant Failure Modes" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=521" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Significant Failure Modes]" ;
skos:definition "Significant failure modes are a subset of credible failure modes (i.e. physically possible). The term significant should be judged in the context of the purpose of the risk assessment and the decisions that it will inform. Factors to consider include Dam Safety Action Classification, comparisons with tolerable risk guidelines, scoping the next level of study, portfolio roll-up of the risk estimates, the level of confidence in risk estimates, representation of uncertainty in estimates, and prioritization for next phase of work. For example credible failure mode should be considered significant if the probability of failure and associated consequences approach closely or exceed a tolerable risk limit guideline." ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;
skos:prefLabel "Significant Failure Modes" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Significant_wave_height   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Significant_wave_height

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Significant_wave_height is a leaf node.

Description

The average height of the one-third highest waves of a given wave group.

Implementation:

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Sill   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Sill

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Sill is a leaf node.

Description

A submerged structure across a river to control the water level upstream. The crest of a spillway. A horizontal gate seating, made of wood, stone, concrete, or metal at the invert of any opening or gap in a structure; hence, the expressions gate sill and stoplog sill.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Sill a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Sill" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=521" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Sill]" ;
skos:definition "A submerged structure across a river to control the water level upstream. The crest of a spillway. A horizontal gate seating, made of wood, stone, concrete, or metal at the invert of any opening or gap in a structure; hence, the expressions gate sill and stoplog sill." ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;
skos:prefLabel "Sill" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Skimmer_gate   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Skimmer_gate

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Skimmer_gate is a leaf node.

Description

A gate at the spillway crest whose prime purpose is to control the release of debris and logs with a limited amount of water. It is usually a bottom hinged flap or Bascule gate.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .

@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Skimmer gate]" ;

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Societal_Risk   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Societal_Risk

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Societal_Risk is a leaf node.

Description

The risk of widespread or large scale detriment from the realization of a defined risk, the implication being that the consequence would be on such a scale as to provoke a socio/political response, and/or that the risk (that is, the likelihood combined with the consequence) provokes public discussion and is effectively regulated by society as a whole through its political processes and regulatory mechanisms. Such large risks are typically unevenly distributed, as are their attendant benefits. Thus the construction of a dam represents a risk to those close by and a benefit to those further off, or a process may harm some future generation more than the present one. The distribution and balancing of such major costs and benefits is a classic function of Government, subject to public discussion and discussion (HSE, 1995 reference A.144) and (ANCOLD October 2003) (reference A.130).

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Societal_Risk a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Societal Risk" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=521" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Societal Risk]" ;
skos:definition "The risk of widespread or large scale detriment from the realization of a defined risk, the implication being that the consequence would be on such a scale as to provoke a socio/political response, and/or that the risk (that is, the likelihood combined with the consequence) provokes public discussion and is effectively regulated by society as a whole through its political processes and regulatory mechanisms. Such large risks are typically unevenly distributed, as are their attendant benefits. Thus the construction of a dam represents a risk to those close by and a benefit to those further off, or a process may harm some future generation more than the present one. The distribution and balancing of such major costs and benefits is a classic function of Government, subject to public discussion and discussion (HSE, 1995 reference A.144) and (ANCOLD October 2003) (reference A.130)." ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;
skos:prefLabel "Societal Risk" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Societal_incremental_life_safety_tolerable_risk_guideline   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Societal_incremental_life_safety_tolerable_risk_guideline

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Societal_incremental_life_safety_tolerable_risk_guideline is a leaf node.

Description

For existing dams, the societal risk should be less than the limit line shown in the chart of societal risk guideline for existing dams, except in extraordinary circumstances, following an adaptation of the ANCOLD (2003) (reference A.130) and NSW(2006) (reference A.147) societal life safety risk guideline. For new dams or Section 216 major modifications (reference A.7), the societal risk should be less than the limit line shown in the chart for societal risk guideline for new dams and Section 216 major modifications (reference A.7), except in extraordinary circumstances, following an adaptation of the ANCOLD (2003) (reference A.130) and NSW (2006) (reference A.147) societal life safety risk guideline. Societal risks are to be lower than the limit lines to an extent determined in accordance with the ALARP principle.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Societal_incremental_life_safety_tolerable_risk_guideline a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Societal incremental life safety tolerable risk guideline" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=521" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Societal incremental life safety tolerable risk guideline]" ;
skos:definition "For existing dams, the societal risk should be less than the limit line shown in the chart of societal risk guideline for existing dams, except in extraordinary circumstances, following an adaptation of the ANCOLD (2003) (reference A.130) and NSW(2006) (reference A.147) societal life safety risk guideline. For new dams or Section 216 major modifications (reference A.7), the societal risk should be less than the limit line shown in the chart for societal risk guideline for new dams and Section 216 major modifications (reference A.7), except in extraordinary circumstances, following an adaptation of the ANCOLD (2003) (reference A.130) and NSW (2006) (reference A.147) societal life safety risk guideline. Societal risks are to be lower than the limit lines to an extent determined in accordance with the ALARP principle." ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;
skos:prefLabel "Societal incremental life safety tolerable risk guideline" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Special_Assistant_for_Dam_and_Levee_Safety   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Special_Assistant_for_Dam_and_Levee_Safety

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Special_Assistant_for_Dam_and_Levee_Safety is a leaf node.

Description

Acts for the USACE DSO in the execution of daily program activities and serves as Chairman of the DSSC and the DSOG. The Special Assistant must be a registered professional civil engineer with management abilities, be competent in the areas related to the design, construction, or evaluation of dams and understand adverse dam incidents and the potential causes and consequences of dam failure. The Special Assistant works for and reports directly to the USACE DSO and represents the USACE DSO in the development of the budget submission, working with the appropriate Business Line Managers and the RMC to ensure that dam safety priorities are addressed. The Special Assistant serves as the Department of Defense and/or USACE representative on various national teams as directed by the USACE DSO.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Special_Assistant_for_Dam_and_Levee_Safety a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Special Assistant for Dam and Levee Safety" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=522" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Special Assistant for Dam and Levee Safety]" ;
skos:definition "Acts for the USACE DSO in the execution of daily program activities and serves as Chairman of the DSSC and the DSOG. The Special Assistant must be a registered professional civil engineer with management abilities, be competent in the areas related to the design, construction, or evaluation of dams and understand adverse dam incidents and the potential causes and consequences of dam failure. The Special Assistant works for and reports directly to the USACE DSO and represents the USACE DSO in the development of the budget submission, working with the appropriate Business Line Managers and the RMC to ensure that dam safety priorities are addressed. The Special Assistant serves as the Department of Defense and/or USACE representative on various national teams as directed by the USACE DSO." ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;
skos:prefLabel "Special Assistant for Dam and Levee Safety" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Spillway   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Spillway

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Spillway is a leaf node.

Description

A structure over or through which flow is discharged from a reservoir. If the rate of flow is controlled by mechanical means such as gates, it is considered a controlled spillway. If the geometry of the spillway is the only control, it is considered an uncontrolled spillway.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Spillway a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Spillway" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=522" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Spillway]" ;
skos:definition "A structure over or through which flow is discharged from a reservoir. If the rate of flow is controlled by mechanical means such as gates, it is considered a controlled spillway. If the geometry of the spillway is the only control, it is considered an uncontrolled spillway." ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;
skos:prefLabel "Spillway" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Spillway,_auxiliary   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Spillway,_auxiliary

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Spillway,_auxiliary is a leaf node.

Description

Any secondary spillway, which is designed to be operated very infrequently and possibly in anticipation of some degree of structural damage or erosion to the spillway during operation.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .

@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

<https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#Spillway,_auxiliary> a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Spillway, auxiliary" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=522" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Spillway, auxiliary]" ;

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Spillway,_fuse_plug   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Spillway,_fuse_plug

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Spillway,_fuse_plug is a leaf node.

Description

A form of auxiliary spillway consisting of a low embankment designed to be overtopped and washed away during an exceptionally large flood.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .

@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Spillway,_primary_%28or_service%29   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Spillway,_primary_%28or_service%29

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Spillway,_primary_%28or_service%29 is a leaf node.

Description

A spillway designed to provide continuous or frequent releases from a reservoir without significant damage to either the dam or its appurtenant structures.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

<https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#Spillway,_primary_%28or_service%29> a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Spillway, primary (or service)" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=522" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Spillway, primary (or service)]" ;
skos:definition "A spillway designed to provide continuous or frequent releases from a reservoir without significant damage to either the dam or its appurtenant structures." ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;
skos:prefLabel "Spillway, primary (or service)" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Spillway,_shaft   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Spillway,_shaft

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Spillway,_shaft is a leaf node.

Description

A vertical or inclined shaft into which water spills and then is conveyed through, under, or around a dam by means of a conduit or tunnel. If the upper part of the shaft is splayed cut and terminates in a circular horizontal weir, it is termed a bellmouth or morning glory spillway.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

<https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#Spillway,_shaft> a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Spillway, shaft" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=523" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Spillway, shaft]" ;
skos:definition "A vertical or inclined shaft into which water spills and then is conveyed through, under, or around a dam by means of a conduit or tunnel. If the upper part of the shaft is splayed cut and terminates in a circular horizontal weir, it is termed a bellmouth or morning glory spillway." ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;
skos:prefLabel "Spillway, shaft" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Stilling_basin   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Stilling_basin

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Stilling_basin is a leaf node.

Description

A basin constructed to dissipate the energy of rapidly flowing water, e.g., from a spillway or outlet, and to protect the riverbed from erosion.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Stoplogs   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Stoplogs

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Stoplogs is a leaf node.

Description

Large logs, timbers, metal beams, or metal frames placed on top of each other with their ends held in guides on each side of a channel or conduit so as to provide a cheaper or more easily handled means of temporary closure than a bulkhead gate.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=523" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Stoplogs]" ;
skos:definition "Large logs, timbers, metal beams, or metal frames placed on top of each other with their ends held in guides on each side of a channel or conduit so as to provide a cheaper or more easily handled means of temporary closure than a bulkhead gate." ;

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Storage   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Storage

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Storage is a leaf node.

Description

The retention of water or delay of runoff either by planned operation, as in a reservoir, or by temporary filling of overflow areas, as in the progression of a flood wave through a natural stream channel. Definitions of specific types of storage in reservoirs are:

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .

@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

skos:definition "The retention of water or delay of runoff either by planned operation, as in a reservoir, or by temporary filling of overflow areas, as in the progression of a flood wave through a natural stream channel. Definitions of specific types of storage in reservoirs are:" ;

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Tailrace   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Tailrace

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Tailrace is a leaf node.

Description

The tunnel, channel, or conduit that conveys the discharge from the turbine to the river; hence, the terms tailrace tunnel and tailrace canal.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .

@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Tailrace]" ;
