Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Tailwater_level   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Tailwater_level

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Tailwater_level is a leaf node.

Description

The level of water in the tailrace at the nearest free surface to the turbine or in the discharge channel immediately downstream of the dam.

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Threshold_Flood   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Threshold_Flood

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Threshold_Flood is a leaf node.

Description

The flood that fully utilizes the existing dam, i.e., the flood that just exceeds the design maximum water surface elevation at the dam.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .

@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .

@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Threshold Flood" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=524" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Threshold Flood]" ;

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Toe_of_dam   back to top

    • ER-1110-2-1156:Toe_of_dam

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Tolerable_Risk   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Tolerable_Risk

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Tolerable_Risk is a leaf node.

Description

A risk within a range that society can live with so as to secure the benefits provided by the dam. It is a range of risk that we do not regard as negligible or as something we might ignore, but rather as something we need to keep under review and reduce it still further if and as we can (HSE, 1999 reference A.145). In addition to the tolerable risk limit the ALARP considerations will be applied to determine tolerable risk.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Tolerable_Risk a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Tolerable Risk" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=524" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Tolerable Risk]" ;
skos:definition "A risk within a range that society can live with so as to secure the benefits provided by the dam. It is a range of risk that we do not regard as negligible or as something we might ignore, but rather as something we need to keep under review and reduce it still further if and as we can (HSE, 1999 reference A.145). In addition to the tolerable risk limit the ALARP considerations will be applied to determine tolerable risk." ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;
skos:prefLabel "Tolerable Risk" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Tolerable_Risk_Guidelines   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Tolerable_Risk_Guidelines

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Tolerable_Risk_Guidelines is a leaf node.

Description

Tolerable risk guidelines are used in risk management to guide the process of examining and judging the significance of estimated risks obtained using risk assessment. The outcomes of risk assessment are inputs to the risk management decision process along with other considerations. Meeting or achieving the tolerable risk guidelines is the goal for all risk reduction measures including permanent and interim measures.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Tolerable_Risk_Guidelines a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Tolerable Risk Guidelines" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=524" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Tolerable Risk Guidelines]" ;
skos:definition "Tolerable risk guidelines are used in risk management to guide the process of examining and judging the significance of estimated risks obtained using risk assessment. The outcomes of risk assessment are inputs to the risk management decision process along with other considerations. Meeting or achieving the tolerable risk guidelines is the goal for all risk reduction measures including permanent and interim measures." ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;
skos:prefLabel "Tolerable Risk Guidelines" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Tolerable_Risk_Limit   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Tolerable_Risk_Limit

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Tolerable_Risk_Limit is a leaf node.

Description

Tolerable risk limit, as depicted on Figure 5.1, defines the limit separating the unacceptable risk region from the range of tolerability.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .

@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

rdfs:label "Tolerable Risk Limit" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=524" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Tolerable Risk Limit]" ;

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Tunnel is a leaf node.

A long underground excavation with two or more openings to the surface, usually having a uniform cross section used for access, conveying flows, etc.

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Type_II_IEPR   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Type_II_IEPR

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Type_II_IEPR is a leaf node.

Description

A Safety Assurance Review (SAR) of design and construction activities for flood damage reduction or coastal storm damage reduction projects or for other activities that affect public safety, and will also be conducted for reviewing the relevancy and effectiveness of USACE inspection of completed works and safety programs in promoting safety and competent performance. They are not required to be managed by OEO's and may be managed by USACE, MSC, or by an outside organization. While all aspects of the project may be included in the review, it will focus on the public safety aspects.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Type_II_IEPR a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Type II IEPR" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=525" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Type II IEPR]" ;
skos:definition "A Safety Assurance Review (SAR) of design and construction activities for flood damage reduction or coastal storm damage reduction projects or for other activities that affect public safety, and will also be conducted for reviewing the relevancy and effectiveness of USACE inspection of completed works and safety programs in promoting safety and competent performance. They are not required to be managed by OEO's and may be managed by USACE, MSC, or by an outside organization. While all aspects of the project may be included in the review, it will focus on the public safety aspects." ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;
skos:prefLabel "Type II IEPR" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Type_I_IEPR   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Type_I_IEPR

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Type_I_IEPR is a leaf node.

Description

An Independent External Peer Review conducted for feasibility, reevaluation, modification, and assessment reports with an EIS and managed by an outside eligible organization (OEO) that is described in Internal Revenue Code Section 501(c) (3); as exempt from Federal tax under section 501(a), of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986; as independent; as free from conflicts of interest; does not carry out or advocate for or against Federal water resources projects; and has experience in establishing and administering IEPR panels. These reviews are exempt from the Federal Advisory Committees Act (FACA). The scope of review will address all the underlying planning, engineering, including safety assurance, economics, and environmental analyses performed, not just one aspect of the project.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Type_I_IEPR a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Type I IEPR" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=524" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Type I IEPR]" ;
skos:definition "An Independent External Peer Review conducted for feasibility, reevaluation, modification, and assessment reports with an EIS and managed by an outside eligible organization (OEO) that is described in Internal Revenue Code Section 501(c) (3); as exempt from Federal tax under section 501(a), of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986; as independent; as free from conflicts of interest; does not carry out or advocate for or against Federal water resources projects; and has experience in establishing and administering IEPR panels. These reviews are exempt from the Federal Advisory Committees Act (FACA). The scope of review will address all the underlying planning, engineering, including safety assurance, economics, and environmental analyses performed, not just one aspect of the project." ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;
skos:prefLabel "Type I IEPR" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Unacceptable_Risk_Region   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Unacceptable_Risk_Region

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Unacceptable_Risk_Region is a leaf node.

Description

The region within the risk range shown in figure 5.1 that is above the zone referred to as the 'Range of Tolerability'. In the 'Unacceptable Region' the risk is considered unacceptable and cannot be justified except in extraordinary circumstance HSE (2001) (reference A.146)

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Unacceptable_Risk_Region a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Unacceptable Risk Region" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=525" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Unacceptable Risk Region]" ;
skos:definition "The region within the risk range shown in figure 5.1 that is above the zone referred to as the 'Range of Tolerability'. In the 'Unacceptable Region' the risk is considered unacceptable and cannot be justified except in extraordinary circumstance HSE (2001) (reference A.146)" ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;
skos:prefLabel "Unacceptable Risk Region" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Uncertainty   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Uncertainty

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Uncertainty is a leaf node.

Description

Uncertainty is the result of imperfect knowledge concerning the present or future state of a system, event, situation, or (sub) population under consideration. The level of uncertainty governs the confidence in predictions, inferences, or conclusions.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Uncertainty a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Uncertainty" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=525" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Uncertainty]" ;
skos:definition "Uncertainty is the result of imperfect knowledge concerning the present or future state of a system, event, situation, or (sub) population under consideration. The level of uncertainty governs the confidence in predictions, inferences, or conclusions." ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;
skos:prefLabel "Uncertainty" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Upstream_blanket   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Upstream_blanket

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Upstream_blanket is a leaf node.

Description

An impervious blanket placed on the reservoir floor and abutments upstream of a dam. For an embankment dam, the blanket may be connected to the core.

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Valve   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Valve

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Valve is a leaf node.

Description

A device fitted to a pipeline or orifice in which the closure member is either rotated or moved transversely or longitudinally in the waterway so as to control or stop the flow.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .

@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Variability   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Variability

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Variability is a leaf node.

Description

One of two components often thought of as comprising 'uncertainty'. Epistemic or 'knowledge uncertainty' that is possible to reduce with additional data and study; and aleatory or 'natural variability' that reflects a process that is random but uncertainty in its magnitude and values may not be reduced with additional data and study. Annual stream flow is an example of 'natural variability.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Variability a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Variability" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=526" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Variability]" ;
skos:definition "One of two components often thought of as comprising 'uncertainty'. Epistemic or 'knowledge uncertainty' that is possible to reduce with additional data and study; and aleatory or 'natural variability' that reflects a process that is random but uncertainty in its magnitude and values may not be reduced with additional data and study. Annual stream flow is an example of 'natural variability." ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;
skos:prefLabel "Variability" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Volume_of_dam   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Volume_of_dam

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Volume_of_dam is a leaf node.

Description

The total space occupied by the materials forming the dam structure computed between abutments and from top to bottom of dam. No deduction is made for small openings such as galleries, adits, tunnels, and operating chambers within the dam structure. Portions of powerplants, locks, spillway, etc., should be included only if they are necessary for the structural stability of the dam.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Volume_of_dam a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Volume of dam" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=526" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Volume of dam]" ;
skos:definition "The total space occupied by the materials forming the dam structure computed between abutments and from top to bottom of dam. No deduction is made for small openings such as galleries, adits, tunnels, and operating chambers within the dam structure. Portions of powerplants, locks, spillway, etc., should be included only if they are necessary for the structural stability of the dam." ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;
skos:prefLabel "Volume of dam" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:WEDGE_Fund   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:WEDGE_Fund

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:WEDGE_Fund is a leaf node.

Description

A special line item in the Construction Remaining items entitled Dam Safety Assurance and Seepage Stability Correction Program. Funding is provided to a project for investigation (study and report) and the start of construction for a dam safety modification while waiting for the current budget cycle project funding to become available.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

rdfs:label "WEDGE Fund" ;

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Water_Control_System   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Water_Control_System

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Water_Control_System is a leaf node.

Description

Any structure or group of structures and its appurtenant components that is used as part of a system to control or modify the conveyance of water such as gates, pumps, valves, motors, controls, power supply, etc.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .

@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Waterstop is a leaf node.

Description

A strip of metal, rubber, or other material used to prevent leakage through joints between adjacent sections of concrete.

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Wave_run-up is a leaf node.

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Weir,_broad-crested   back to top

    • ER-1110-2-1156:Weir,_broad-crested

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Weir,_broad-crested is a leaf node.

Description

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Weir,_measuring   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Weir,_measuring

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Weir,_measuring is a leaf node.

Description

A device for measuring the rate of flow of water. It generally consists of a rectangular, trapezoidal, triangular, or other shaped notch, located in a vertical, thin plate over which water flows. The height of water above the weir crest is used to determine the rate of flow.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

<https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#Weir,_measuring> a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Weir, measuring" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=526" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Weir, measuring]" ;
skos:definition "A device for measuring the rate of flow of water. It generally consists of a rectangular, trapezoidal, triangular, or other shaped notch, located in a vertical, thin plate over which water flows. The height of water above the weir crest is used to determine the rate of flow." ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;
skos:prefLabel "Weir, measuring" .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Weir,_ogee   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Weir,_ogee

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Weir,_ogee is a leaf node.

Description

A reverse curve, shaped like an elongated letter S. The downstream faces of overflow spillways are often made to this shape.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .

@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Willingness-to-Pay-to-Prevent-a-Statistical-Fatality   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Willingness-to-Pay-to-Prevent-a-Statistical-Fatality

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Willingness-to-Pay-to-Prevent-a-Statistical-Fatality is a leaf node.

Description

This is defined as the economic principle that attempts to place a value on a potential life lost by determining the willingness of society to pay to prevent a statistical fatality. Such values are determined from studies of court cases involving involuntary death, from Federal and other agency studies of establishing regulatory standards for public safety.

Implementation:

@prefix ER-1110-2-1156: <https://usace-data.com/civil-works/glossary/ER-1110-2-1156#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix pav: <http://purl.org/pav#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix wov: <http://www.knowledgesmarts.com/ontologies/wov#> .

ER-1110-2-1156:Willingness-to-Pay-to-Prevent-a-Statistical-Fatality a wov:GlossaryTerm,
skos:Concept ;
rdfs:label "Willingness-to-Pay-to-Prevent-a-Statistical-Fatality" ;
dcterms:bibliographicCitation "https://www.publications.usace.army.mil/Portals/76/Users/182/86/2486/er_1110-2-1156.pdf#page=526" ;
pav:wasDerivedFrom "glossaries/CivilWorks/ER-1110-2-1156.yaml#term[Willingness-to-Pay-to-Prevent-a-Statistical-Fatality]" ;
skos:definition "This is defined as the economic principle that attempts to place a value on a potential life lost by determining the willingness of society to pay to prevent a statistical fatality. Such values are determined from studies of court cases involving involuntary death, from Federal and other agency studies of establishing regulatory standards for public safety." ;
skos:inScheme ER-1110-2-1156: ;

Concept: ER-1110-2-1156:Wind_setup   back to top

  • skos:Concept
    • ER-1110-2-1156:Wind_setup

NOTE ER-1110-2-1156:Wind_setup is a leaf node.

Description

The vertical rise in the stillwater level at the face of a structure or embankment caused by wind stresses on the surface of the water.

Implementation:
